definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
to leak (of water or gas)/to drip/to drain/to discharge/to leak out/to divulge (secrets)/to give vent (to anger, spite etc)/to disperse/to reduce

sentences.english: The fact that she was furious to find less left vent.
sentences.chinese: 这令她大为光火，去找左少发泄。

sentences.english: Her detestation and disgust must have found voice.
sentences.chinese: 她一定会发泄她的厌恶和憎恨的。

sentences.english: All Grado headphones have a vented diaphragm design that incorporates a large air chamber.
sentences.chinese: 所有歌德耳机有一个发泄隔膜设计，采用了大型气室。

sentences.english: The "I Love You Virus" wreaks havoc around the world.
sentences.chinese: 那“我爱你病毒”发泄全球的大破坏。

sentences.english: Those who strive for justice must understand that it consists of more than the venting of resentments.
sentences.chinese: 为正义而斗争的人必须懂得正义不仅是发泄怨气。

sentences.english: She always takes her annoyance out on  her husband.
sentences.chinese: 她总是把烦恼发泄到丈夫身上。

sentences.english: So, you want to become the vent their disgrace and deepen himself.
sentences.chinese: 这样的话，你想的发泄就变成了自取其辱和加深痛苦。
你得让被压抑的感情发泄出来。

sentences.english: He vented his anger on his wife.
sentences.chinese: 他在老婆身上发泄怒气。

sentences.english: Running is a good outlet for his energy.
sentences.chinese: 跑步是他发泄过剩精力的好方法。

sentences.english: He visited his anger upon us.
sentences.chinese: 他把愤怒发泄在我们身上。

sentences.english: By punishing them, Sony became a target of their considerable wrath.
sentences.chinese: 惩罚了他们，索尼公司成为发泄他们愤怒的靶子。

sentences.english: She angry you will the station settle to him dozen, let her thoroughly let out.
sentences.chinese: 她生气，你就要站定给她打，让她好好的发泄。

sentences.english: SaiLin heartbreak in bar drink, dance, vent.
sentences.chinese: 赛琳心碎地在酒吧喝酒，跳舞，发泄。

sentences.english: Don't pay any attention to him. He's just blowing off steam.
sentences.chinese: 不要管他，他不过是发泄一下闷气罢了。

sentences.english: Soon I was taking my pent-up anger out on Dick.
sentences.chinese: 我很快就把被压抑的愤怒发泄到迪克身上。

definition: to drain (by leading off water)/to unburden oneself/to divulge/to leak a secret
to mediate/to reconcile/to make peace/to intervene
to divert oneself from (loneliness, grief etc)/to dispel (negative thoughts etc)
to relieve/to ease (pressure)/to alleviate/to remove/to get rid of
to resent/to harbor a grudge against/to loathe/resentment/rancor
